news_header: Crude oil prices fell further on Thursday, reaching a one-month low due to increased U.S. oil production and rising inventories.
news_original_title: Oil Prices See Further Downside As Trump Reiterates Pledge To Boost Production
news_text: Crude oil prices continued to decline on Thursday, dropping $0.42 to $70.61 a barrel, following a significant drop the previous day. This decline is attributed to President Trump's commitment to boost U.S. oil production and a stronger U.S. dollar. Additionally, a report indicated a sharp increase in U.S. crude oil inventories, which rose by 8.7 million barrels last week, exceeding economists' expectations.
